intro: Didymosperma microcarpum, commonly known as the small-fruited didymosperma, is a member of the family Malvaceae. It is a shrub-like plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists studying xerophytic plants.
